10.q: Where did Solomon station his chariots and horsemen?

10.a: The king made cedar wood become as abundant as the sycamore fig trees in the lowlands.
10.q: What did the king do with cedar wood?

10.a: Solomon's horses were brought from Egypt and Cilicia.
10.q: From where were Solomon's horses brought?

10.a: The chariots were purchased for six hundred shekels of silver each.
10.q: What was the purchase price of each chariot Solomon owned?

11.a: King Solomon loved many foreign women.
11.q: Whom did King Solomon love?

11.a: Yahweh commanded Israel not to marry women from foreign nations.
11.q: What did Yahweh command about marrying women from foreign nations?

11.a: Solomon's wives turned his heart away.
11.q: What did Solomon's wives do to his heart?

11.a: David's heart was fully surrendered to Yahweh his God.
11.q: How was David's heart toward Yahweh?

11.a: Solomon followed Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians and Milcom of the Ammonites.
11.q: What did Solomon follow?

11.a: Solomon did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh.
11.q: What did Solomon do in the sight of Yahweh?

11.a: Solomon built a shrine for Chemosh, the idol of Moab.
11.q: What did Solomon build for Chemosh?

11.a: Solomon burned incense and sacrificed to their gods at the shrines.
11.q: What did Solomon do at the shrines of his foreign wives?

11.a: Yahweh appeared twice to Solomon.
11.q: How many times did Yahweh appear to Solomon?

11.a: Yahweh commanded Solomon to not go after foreign gods.
11.q: What did Yahweh command Solomon?

11.a: Yahweh told Solomon he would tear the kingdom from him and give it to his servant.
11.q: What did Yahweh tell Solomon he would do because of the foreign gods?

11.a: Yahweh promised to give one tribe to Solomon's son.
11.q: How many tribes did Yahweh promise to give to Solomon's son?

11.a: Yahweh raised up Hadad the Edomite as an adversary to Solomon.
11.q: Whom did Yahweh raise up as an adversary to Solomon?

11.a: Joab the captain of the army went up to bury the dead who were killed in Edom.
11.q: Who went up to bury the dead who had been killed in Edom?

11.a: Joab and Israel remained in Edom six months.
11.q: How long did Joab and Israel remain in Edom?

11.a: Hadad was taken to Egypt.
11.q: To where was Hadad taken?

11.a: Pharaoh gave to Hadad the sister of Queen Tahpenes as his wife.
11.q: Whom did Pharaoh give as a wife to Hadad?

11.a: Hadad's son was named Genubath.
11.q: What was the name of Hadad's son?

11.a: Hadad asked Pharaoh if he might depart and go to his own country.
11.q: What did Hadad ask of Pharaoh?

11.a: God raised up another adversary to Solomon named Rezon son of Eliada.
11.q: What was the name of another adversary that God raised up against Solomon?

11.a: Rezon's men went to Damascus and lived there.
11.q: To where did Rezon's men travel?

11.a: Rezon was an enemy of Israel all of the days of Solomon.
11.q: How long was Rezon an enemy of Israel?

11.a: Jeroboam the son of Nebat lifted up his hand against the king.
11.q: Who lifted up his hand against the king?

11.a: Jeroboam the son of Nebat lifted up his hand against the king because he built the Millo and repaired the wall of the city of David.
11.q: Why did Jeroboam lift up his hand against the king?

11.a: Solomon gave Jeroboam command over all the labor of the house of Joseph.
11.q: What did Solomon give Jeroboam command over?

11.a: The prophet Ahijah found Jeroboam on the road as he went out of Jerusalem.
11.q: Who found Jeroboam on the road as he went out of Jerusalem?

11.a: Ahijah grabbed Jeroboam's new garment and tore it into twelve pieces.
11.q: What did Ahijah do to Jeroboam's new garment?

11.a: Yahweh said that He would tear the kingdom out of Solomon's hand.
11.q: What did Yahweh say about Solomon's kingdom?

11.a: Solomon would keep one tribe for the sake of David.
11.q: How many tribes would Solomon keep?

11.a: Yahweh made Solomon ruler all the days of his life.
11.q: How long did Yahweh make Solomon to be ruler?

11.a: Yahweh chose to put his name in the city of Jerusalem.
11.q: In which city did Yahweh choose to put his name?

11.a: Yahweh promised to give Jeroboam a sure house and also give Israel to him if he walked in his ways.
11.q: What did Yahweh promise to do for Jeroboam if he walked in his ways?

11.a: Solomon tried to kill Jeroboam.
11.q: What did Solomon try to do to Jeroboam?

11.a: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem for forty years.
11.q: How long did Solomon reign in Jerusalem?

11.a: Rehoboam became king in Solomon's place.
11.q: Who became king in Solomon's place?

12.a: Rehoboam went to Shechem because all Israel was coming there to make him king.
12.q: Why did Rehoboam go to Shechem?

12.a: Jeroboam the son of Nebat came with the assembly of Israel to speak to Rehoboam.
12.q: Who came with the assembly of Israel to speak to Rehoboam?

12.a: All Israel asked that Rehoboam would lighten the heavy yoke his father had put on them.
12.q: What did Israel ask of Rehoboam?

12.a: Rehoboam sent the people away for three days.
12.q: For how many days did Rehoboam send the people away?

12.a: Rehoboam consulted with the older men who stood before Solomon his father.
12.q: With whom did Rehoboam consult?

12.a: The older men said that Rehoboam should say good words to the people of Israel.
12.q: What did the older men say to Rehoboam?

12.a: Rehoboam ignored the advice of the older men.
12.q: What did Rehoboam do with the advice the older men gave him?

12.a: The younger men told Rehoboam to say, "My little finger is thicker than my father's waist."
12.q: What did the younger men tell Rehoboam to say to the people?

12.a: Rehoboam said he would use scorpions to punish the people.
12.q: What did Rehoboam say he would use to punish the people?

12.a: The king had instructed the people to come back on the third day.
12.q: What had the king instructed the people to do?

12.a: The king answered the people roughly.
12.q: How did the king answer the people?

12.a: The king said he would add to the yoke on the people.
12.q: What did the king say he would do with the yoke on the people?

12.a: These events were brought about by Yahweh.
12.q: Who brought about these events?

12.a: All Israel said, "We have no inheritance in the son of Jesse; flee to your tents."
12.q: What did all Israel say when they saw that the king did not listen to them?

12.a: Rehoboam became king over the people of Israel who lived in the cities of Judah.
12.q: Over what people did Rehoboam become king?

12.a: All Israel stoned Adoram to death with stones.
12.q: What did Israel do to Adoram?

12.a: Only the tribe of Judah followed the family of David.
12.q: Who followed the family of David?

12.a: Rehoboam assembled the house of Judah to fight against the house of Israel.
12.q: Why did Rehoboam assemble the house of Judah in Jerusalem?

12.a: The word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God.
12.q: To whom did the word of God come?

12.a: Yahweh said, "You must not attack or fight against your brothers the people of Israel."
12.q: What did Yahweh say?

12.a: Jeroboam built Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim.
12.q: Where did Jerohoam build Shechem?

12.a: Jeroboam thought in his heart, "Now the kingdom will return to the house of David."
12.q: What did Jeroboam think in his heart?

12.a: Jeroboam said, "If these people offer sacrifices in the temple of Yahweh, they will kill me and return to Rehoboam king of Judah."
12.q: What did Jeroboam say about the people offering sacrifices in the temple of Yahweh?

12.a: King Jeroboam made two calves of gold.
12.q: What did King Jeroboam make?

12.a: King Jeroboam set up one calf in Bethel and one in Dan.
12.q: Where did Jeroboam set up the two calves of gold?

12.a: Jeroboam made priests of the people who were not among the sons of Levi.
12.q: What people did Jeroboam make into priests?

12.a: Jeroboam ordained a feast at Bethel.
12.q: What did Jeroboam do at Bethel?

12.a: Jeroboam went up to the altar to burn incense.
12.q: What did Jeroboam do at the altar in Bethel?

13.a: A man of God came out of Judah by the word of Yahweh.
13.q: Who came out of Judah by the word of Yahweh?

13.a: The man of God cried out against the altar, "On you they will burn men's bones."
13.q: What did the man of God cry out against the altar at Bethel?

13.a: The man of God gave a sign saying, "The altar will be split apart and the ashes on it will be poured out."
13.q: What sign did the man of God give about the altar?

13.a: When Jeroboam reached out from the altar, his hand was dried up so he could not draw it back to himself.
13.q: What happened to Jeroboam's hand when he reached out from the altar?

13.a: The altar was split apart and the ashes poured out as the man of God described.
13.q: What happened to the altar?

13.a: When the man of God prayed to Yahweh, the king's hand was restored and became as it was before.
13.q: What happened when the man of God prayed to Yahweh about Jeroboam's hand?

13.a: The king said to the man of God, "Come home with me and I will give you a reward."
13.q: What did the king say to the man of God?

13.a: The man of God said to the king, "I will not go with you."
13.q: What did the man of God say to the king?

13.a: After speaking with the king, the man of God returned home by a different way than he came to Bethel.
13.q: What did the man of God do after speaking with the king?

13.a: An old prophet lived in Bethel.
13.q: Where did an old prophet live?

13.a: The old prophet's sons saw the way that the man of God went to Bethel.
13.q: Who saw the way that the man of God had gone from Bethel?

13.a: The old prophet found the man of God sitting under an oak tree.
13.q: Where did the old prophet find the man of God?

13.a: The old prophet said to the man of God, "Come home with me and eat food."
13.q: What did the old prophet say to the man of God?

13.a: The man of God answered, "I may not return with you or go in with you."
13.q: What was the man of God's answer to the old prophet?

13.a: The old prophet was lying to the man of God and answered, "An angel spoke by the word of Yahweh saying 'Bring him back to your house.'"
13.q: What was the old prophet's answer to the man of God?

13.a: The man of God went back and ate food and drank water in his house.
13.q: Where did the man of God go after the old prophet lied to him?

13.a: The word of Yahweh came to the old prophet as they sat at the table.
13.q: What came to the old prophet as they sat at the table?

13.a: The word of Yahweh said, "Because you came back and ate food and drank water your body will not be buried in the tomb of your fathers."
13.q: What did the word of Yahweh say to the man of God?

13.a: After they ate, the old prophet saddled the man of God's donkey for him.
13.q: What did the old prophet do after they ate?

13.a: After the man of God had gone, a lion met him on the road and killed him.
13.q: What happened after the man of God had gone?

13.a: When men saw the man of God's body lying on the road, they came back and told it in the city of the old prophet.
13.q: What did men do when they saw the body of the man of God lying on the road?

13.a: The old prophet answered, "This is the man of God who was disobedient to the word of Yahweh."
13.q: What was the old prophet's answer to the men?

13.a: The old prophet spoke to his sons to saddle his donkey and he went and found the body left in the road.
13.q: What did the old prophet do after hearing the men?

13.a: The old prophet took up the body of the man of God and buried him in his own grave.
13.q: What did the old prophet do with the body of the man of God?

13.a: The old prophet said to his sons, "When I am dead, bury me in the tomb in which the man of God is buried."
13.q: What did the old prophet say to his sons about his own burial?

13.a: Jeroboam did not turn away from evil and consecrated as priests whomever he would; this thing became sin to the family of Jeroboam.
13.q: What thing became sin to the family of Jeroboam and caused it to be cut off from the face of the earth?

14.a: Abijah the son of Jeroboam fell sick.
14.q: What happened to Abijah the son of Jeroboam?

14.a: Jeroboam asked his wife to disguise herself and go to the prophet Ahijah in Shiloh.
14.q: What did Jeroboam ask his wife to do?

14.a: Jeroboam asked his wife to go to the prophet Ahijah to find out what would happen to his sick son.
14.q: Why did Jeroboam ask his wife to go to the prophet Ahijah?

14.a: Since Ahijah was old he was blind and his eyes could not see.
14.q: What was wrong with Ahijah's eyes?

14.a: Yahweh told Ahijah, "The wife of Jeroboam is coming to see you to seek advice concerning her son."
14.q: Who told Ahijah, "The wife of Jeroboam is coming to see you."?

14.a: When Ahijan heard her come in at the door he said to her, "Why do you pretend to be someone that you are not?"
14.q: What did Ahijah say to the wife of Jeroboam?

14.a: The God of Israel said to Jeroboam, "You have not been like my servant David who kept my commandments."
14.q: What did the God of Israel say about Jeroboam?

14.a: Jeroboam cast metal images to provoke Yahweh to anger.
14.q: What did Jeroboam do to provoke Yahweh to anger?

14.a: Yahweh said that he would cut off from him every male child in Israel.
14.q: What disaster would Yahweh bring on Jeroboam?

14.a: Anyone of Jeroboam's family who died in the city would be eaten by dogs.
14.q: What would happen to anyone of Jeroboam's family who died in the city?

14.a: All Israel would mourn for and bury the child of Jeroboam.
14.q: What would all Israel do for the child of Jeroboam?

14.a: Yahweh said that he would scatter Israel beyond the Euphrates river.
14.q: How far did Yahweh say that he would scatter Israel?

14.a: Yahweh said that Jeroboam led Israel to sin.
14.q: What did Yahweh say that Jeroboam led Israel to do?

14.a: When Jeroboam's wife came to the threshold of the house, the child died.
14.q: What happened when Jeroboam's wife came to the threshold of the house?

14.a: All Israel mourned for him and buried him.
14.q: What did all Israel do after the child died?

14.a: The other matters concerning Jeroboam were written in the Book of the Events of the Kings of Israel.
14.q: Where were the other matters concerning Jeroboam written?

14.a: Jeroboam reigned for twenty-two years and slept with his fathers.
14.q: How many years did Jeroboam reign before he slept with his fathers?

14.a: Rehoboam the son of Solomon was reigning in Judah.
14.q: Who was reigning in Judah?

14.a: Judah provoked Yahweh to jealousy with the sins they committed.
14.q: How did Judah provoke Yahweh to jealousy?

14.a: Judah built shrines and Asherah poles on every high hill and under every green tree.
14.q: What did Judah build on every high hill and under every green tree?

14.a: The nations had male prostitutes in the land.
14.q: What despicable things did the nations do?

14.a: In the fifth year of king Rehoboam, Shishak came up against Jerusalem.
14.q: In what year did Shishak come up against Jerusalem?

14.a: Shishak took the shields of gold that Solomon had made.
14.q: What shields did Shishak take away from Jerusalem?

14.a: King Rehoboam entrusted them into the hands of the commander of the guard.
14.q: What did King Rehoboam do with the shields of bronze that he made?

14.a: Whenever the king entered the house of Yahweh, the guards would carry the shields.
14.q: When would the guards carry the shields of bronze?

14.a: The other matters of King Rehoboam were written in The Book of the Events of the Kings of Judah.
14.q: Where were the other matters of King Rehoboam written?

14.a: Abijah, Rehoboam's son, became king in his place.
14.q: Who became king in Rehoboam's place?

15.a: Abijah began to reign over Judah in the fifteenth year of King Jeroboam.
15.q: When did Abijah begin to reign over Judah?

15.a: Abijah ruled in Jerusalem for three years.
15.q: How long did Abijah rule in Jerusalem?

15.a: Abijah's heart was not devoted to Yahweh his God.
15.q: Was Abijah's heart devoted to Yahweh his God?

15.a: Yahweh raised up a son for Abijah to strengthen Jerusalem.
15.q: Why did Yahweh raise up a son for Abijah in Jerusalem?

15.a: David only turned away from Yahweh in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
15.q: In what matter did David turn away from Yahweh?

15.a: There was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of Abijah's life.
15.q: What happened all the days of Abijah's life?

15.a: When Abijah slept with his fathers Asa became king in his place.
15.q: When Abijah slept with his fathers who became king in his place?

15.a: Asa began to reign over Judah in the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Jerusalem.
15.q: When did Asa begin to reign over Judah?

15.a: Asa reigned forty-one years in Jerusalem.
15.q: How many years did Asa reign in Jerusalem?

15.a: Asa did what was right in the eyes of Yahweh as David had done.
15.q: What did Asa do in the eyes of Yahweh?

15.a: Asa removed the male prostitutes and the idols his ancestors had made in the land.
15.q: What did Asa do in the land?

15.a: Asa removed his own grandmother Maacah from being queen.
15.q: Whom did Asa remove from being queen?

15.a: Asa's heart was completely devoted to Yahweh all his days.
15.q: What was the condition of Asa's heart toward Yahweh?

15.a: Asa brought consecrated things into the house of Yahweh.
15.q: What did Asa bring into the house of Yahweh?

15.a: Asa was at war with Baasha king of Israel all their days.
15.q: With whom was Asa at war?

15.a: Baasha built up Ramah so that no one would enter into or leave the land of Asa.
15.q: Why did Baasha build up Ramah?

15.a: Asa sent the silver and gold to Benhadad who lived in Damascus.
15.q: What did Asa do with all the silver and gold from the storerooms of the house of Yahweh?

15.a: Asa said to Benhadad, "Let there be a treaty between me and you, as there was between my father and your father."
15.q: What did Asa say to Benhadad?

15.a: After he listened to Asa, Benhadad sent his armies to attack the cities of Israel.
15.q: What did Benhadad do after he listened to Asa?

15.a: When Baasha heard about the attacks, he stopped building up Ramah.
15.q: What did Baasha do when he heard about this?

15.a: Asa took the materials that were used to build up Ramah and used them to build up Geba and Mizpah.
15.q: What did Asa do with the materials that were used to build up Ramah?

15.a: All of Asa's matters were written in The Book of the Events of the Kings of Judah.
15.q: Where were all of Asa's matters written?

15.a: After Asa slept with his fathers, his son Jehoshephat became king in his place.
15.q: After Asa slept with his fathers, who became king in his place?

15.a: Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa.
15.q: Who began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa?

15.a: Nadab did evil in the sight of Yahweh and walked in the ways of his father.
15.q: How did Nadab walk in the sight of Yahweh?

15.a: Baasha the son of Ahijah killed Nadab at Gibbethon.
15.q: What did Baasha son of Ahijah do at Gibbethon?

15.a: As soon as Baasha became king, he killed all of the family of Jeroboam.
15.q: What did Baasha do as soon as he became king?

15.a: There was war between Asa and Baasha all their days.
15.q: How long was there war between Asa and Baasha?

15.a: Baasha reigned in Tirza for twenty-four years.
15.q: How long did Baasha reign in Tirza?

15.a: Baasha did evil in the sight of Yahweh and lived in the way of Jeroboam.
15.q: How did Baasha live?

16.a: Yahweh exalted him out of the dust.
16.q: Out of what did Yahweh exalt Baasha?

16.a: The dogs would eat anyone belonging to Baasha who died in the city.
16.q: What would eat anyone belonging to Baasha who died in the city?

16.a: The word of Yahweh came against Baasha and his family, both because of all the evil he did in the sight of Yahweh, and also because he had killed all of Jeroboam's family.
16.q: Why did the word of Yahweh come against Baasha and his family?

16.a: Elah was drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza when Zimri killed him.
16.q: What was Elah doing when Zimri killed him?

16.a: When Zimri began to reign, as soon as he had sat on his throne, he killed all the family of Baasha.
16.q: When did Zimri kill all the family of Baasha?

16.a: Zimri killed himself in the fortress attached to the king's palace.
The people of Israel divided into two parts by Tibni the son of Ginath and by Omri.
16.q: By what two leaders were the people of Israel divided into two parts?

16.a: Omri called the name of the city Samaria, after the name of Shemer, the past owner of the hill.
16.q: Why did Omri call the name of the city Samaria?

16.a: Ahab his son became king in his place.
16.q: Who became king in Omri's place?

16.a: Ahab had built the house of Baal in Samaria.
16.q: Who had built the house of Baal in Samaria?

16.a: Hiel rebuilt Jericho, causing the loss of Abiram.
16.q: What caused the loss of Hiel's son Abiram?

17.a: Elijah told Ahab that as Yahweh lives, there would not be dew or rain unless he said so.
17.q: What ominous message did Elijah give to Ahab?

17.a: Yahweh commanded the ravens to feed Elijah at the brook Cherith.
17.q: Who did Yahweh command to feed Elijah while Elijah was at the brook Cherith?

17.a: The brook dried up when there was no rain in the land.
17.q: What happened when there was no rain in the land?

17.a: Yahweh sent Elijah to a widow in Zarephath.
17.q: Where did Elijah go after the brook dried up?

17.a: The widow was gathering two sticks so she could go in and cook for herself and her son, that they could eat, and die.
17.q: Why was the widow gathering two sticks ?

17.a: They would be full until the day that Yahweh sent rain on the earth.
17.q: For how long would the widow's jar of meal and jug of oil be full?

17.a: The son's sickness was so severe that there was no more breath left in him.
17.q: How sick was the woman's son?

17.a: Elijah stretched himself on the child three times; he cried out to Yahweh and said, "Yahweh my God, I beg you, please let this child's life return to him."
17.q: What did Elijah do to save the child?

17.a: The woman knew that Elijah was a man of God when her son revived, and Elijah took the child and brought him out of his room down into the house.
17.q: How did the woman know that Elijah was a man of God?

18.a: Yahweh asked Elijah to tell Ahab he would send rain on the land.
18.q: What message did Yahweh ask Elijah to give to Ahab during the severe famine?

18.a: Obadiah honored Yahweh by hiding one hundred prophets by fifties in a cave and feeding them with bread and water.
18.q: How did Obadiah honor Yahweh when Jezebel was killing the prophets of Yahweh?

18.a: Ahab and Obadiah were searching for water and grass so they would not lose the horses and mules.
18.q: Why did Ahab and Obadiah go through the land to all the water springs and brooks?

18.a: Elijah asked Obadiah to tell Ahab that "Elijah is here."
18.q: What dangerous message did Elijah ask Obadiah to tell Ahab?

18.a: Obadiah was reluctant to tell Ahab, "Elijah is here." because all the nearby nations had taken an oath that Elijah was not there.
18.q: Why was Obadiah reluctant to tell Ahab that "Elijah is here."?

18.a: Obadiah thought the Spirit of Yahweh would carry Elijah some place Obadiah did not know.
18.q: What did Obadiah think would happen as soon as he left Elijah?

18.a: Elijah told Obadiah that as Yahweh lives, he would surely show himself to Ahab that day.
18.q: What did Elijah tell Obadiah to calm his fears?

18.a: Ahab called Elijah a "troublemaker" when he met him.
18.q: What did Ahab call Elijah when he met him?

18.a: Elijah told Ahab that he and his father's family were the troublemakers because they abandoned the commandments of Yahweh to follow the Baal idols.
18.q: How did Elijah respond to Ahab calling him a "troublemaker"?

18.a: Elijah said to gather all the people of Israel, along with the 450 prophets of Baal and the four hundred prophets of Asherah who eat at Jezebel's table.
18.q: Who did Elijah say to gather on Mount Carmel?

18.a: Elijah told the people to follow Yahweh if he was God or Baal if he was God.
18.q: Who did Elijah tell the people they should follow?

18.a: Elijah proposed that the prophets of Baal and himself each call upon their god to consume the sacrifice of a bull by fire to prove which one was god.
18.q: What proposal did Elijah bring before the people?

18.a: The prophets of Baal called on Baal from morning until noon.
18.q: How long did the prophets of Baal call on Baal?

18.a: The prophets of Baal cried more loudly and cut themselves with swords and spears.
18.q: After Elijah mocked the prophets of Baal at noon what did the prophets of Baal do?

18.a: The prophets of Baal were raving until the time of the evening sacrifice.
18.q: How long did the prophets of Baal continue their raving?

18.a: Elijah repaired the altar of Yahweh with twelve stones,
18.q: What did Elijah do to the ruined altar of Yahweh?

18.a: Elijah dug a trench around the altar of Yahweh.
18.q: What did Elijah make around the altar of Yahweh?

18.a: Three times Elijah had the people fill four jars with water and pour them on the burnt offering and the wood.
18.q: What did Elijah have the people do to the wood and the bull for the burnt offering?

18.a: The people lay face down on the ground and said, "Yahweh, he is God!, Yahweh, he is God!"
18.q: How did the people of Israel respond when the fire of Yahweh fell and consumed the sacrifice and everything around it?

18.a: Elijah brought the prophets of Baal down to the brook of Kishon and killed them.
18.q: What did Elijah do with the prophets of Baal?

18.a: After the seventh time, the servant saw a cloud as small as a man's hand.
18.q: What did the servant of Elijah see after he looked toward the sea seven times?

18.a: Elijah told his servant to tell Ahab to make ready his chariot and go down before the rain stopped him.
18.q: What did Elijah tell his servant to say to Ahab?

18.a: Elijah tucked his robe in his belt and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
18.q: What did Elijah do as Ahab rode and went to Jezreel?

19.a: Jezebel told Elijah that she would make him to be one of the dead prophets by the next day.
19.q: What threat did Jezebel make to Elijah?

19.a: Elijah fled for his life to Beersheba.
19.q: How did Elijah respond to the threat from Jezebel?

19.a: Elijah requested that he might die because he felt he was no better than his dead ancestors.
19.q: Why did Elijah request that he might die?

19.a: An angel touched Elijah and said to him, "Get up and eat."
19.q: What happened as Elijah was sleeping under a broom tree?

19.a: Elijah saw bread that had been baked on coals and a jug of water. Elijah ate and drank and lay down again.
19.q: What did Elijah see and do after the angel touched him?

19.a: Elijah traveled forty days and forty nights to Horeb.
19.q: How long did it take Elijah to get to Horeb, the mountain of God?

19.a: Elijah told Yahweh that he had been very zealous for him, but the people of Israel had forsaken his covenant, destroyed his altars, and killed his prophets, and he was the only one left.
19.q: How did Elijah respond when Yahweh asked him what he was doing in a cave?

19.a: Yahweh told Elijah to return to the wilderness to anoint Hazael to be king over Aram, Jehu to be king over Israel, and Elisha to be a prophet in his place.
19.q: What did Yahweh tell Elijah to do?

19.a: Yahweh told Elijah there were seven thousand people in Israel who were faithful to him.
19.q: How did Yahweh respond to Elijah's claim that he was the only prophet left in the land?

19.a: Elisha asked Elijah to let him kiss his mother and father before he followed him.
19.q: What excuse did Elisha give to Elijah after he draped his cloak on him?

20.a: Ben Hadad told Ahab that his silver and gold as well as his wives and children were now Ben Hadad's possessions.
20.q: What was the message which Ahab received from Ben Hadad when the city of Samaria was under siege?

20.a: Ben Hadad informed Ahab that he was sending his servants the next day, and they would seize with their hands whatever pleased their eyes.
20.q: How did Ben Hadad respond to Ahab's willingness to give him his silver, gold, wives, and children?

20.a: The elders of the land and the people told the king not to listen or consent to the demands of Ben Hadad because he was only seeking trouble.
20.q: What was the advice which the king of Israel received from all the elders of the land and the people?

20.a: Ahab told Ben Hadad that he was agreeable to his first demand, but he could not accept his second demand.
20.q: What was the message Ahab sent back to Ben Hadad?

20.a: Ben Hadad took an oath that he would reduce Samaria to ashes.
20.q: What was the response of Ben Hadad to the message of Ahab?

20.a: Ben Hadad told his soldiers to line up in position to prepare for battle.
20.q: What did Ben Hadad say when the king of Israel told him that he should not boast as if the battle was over?

20.a: Yahweh told Ahab that the young officers who served the governors of the districts would win the battle for Israel.
20.q: Who did Yahweh say would win the battle for Israel against the great army of the Arameans?

20.a: Ben Hadad and his thirty-two lesser kings were drinking themselves drunk.
20.q: When the young officers who served the governors of the districts went forward first what were Ben Hadad and the thirty-two lesser kings who were supporting him doing?

20.a: Ben Hadad escaped on a horse with some horsemen and many or the Arameans were killed in a great slaughter.
20.q: What happened to Ben Hadad and the Arameans?

20.a: The prophet told the king of Israel that the king of Aram would return against them again, so Israel should strengthen itself and plan what they would do.
20.q: What message did the prophet bring to the king of Israel?

20.a: The servants of the king of Aram told him Israel was stronger than the Arameans, since their god is a god of the hills.
20.q: What did the servants of the king of Aram give as the reason for Israel being stronger in battle than the Arameans?

20.a: Ben Hadad mustered the Arameans and went up to Aphek to fight against Israel.
20.q: What did Ben Hadad do after the beginning of the new year?

20.a: The man of God said that because the Arameans said God was a god of the hills and not a god of the valleys, God was going to place the Aramean army into the hands of the king of Israel.
20.q: What did a man of God say to the king of Israel concerning the Arameans?

20.a: Israel killed one hundred thousand Aramean footmen in one day. The rest fled to Aphek, into the city where a wall fell on twenty-seven thousand men who were left and Ben Hadad fled into the city into an inner room.
20.q: What was the outcome of the battle between the armies?

20.a: Ben Hadad's servants put sackcloth on their waists and ropes around their heads and went to the king of Israel and begged the king of Israel to let Ben Hadad live.
20.q: What did Ben Hadad's servants do for Ben Hadad?

20.a: Ben Hadad told Ahab that he would restore to him the cities which had been taken from Israel if Ahab would let him go.
20.q: What proposal did Ben Hadad make to Ahab when he was summoned to meet with him in his chariot?

20.a: One of the prophets was killed by a lion because he did not obey the voice of Yahweh by hitting his fellow prophet.
20.q: Why was one of the prophets killed by a lion?

20.a: The prophet disguised himself from the king with a bandage over his eyes.
20.q: How did the prophet disguise himself from the king after he had been hit and wounded?

20.a: The prophet told the story to the king of Israel to deceive him, so the king would make a ruling which would result in the forfeit of the king's own life.
20.q: Why did the prophet tell a story to the king of Israel?

20.a: The prophet told the king that he would lose his own life since he had allowed the man whom Yahweh had sentenced to death to live.
20.q: What bold statement did the prophet make to the king of Israel?

21.a: Ahab, king of Samaria, wanted the vineyard from Naboth, which was near his palace.
21.q: What did Ahab the king of Samaria want from Naboth the Jezreelite?

21.a: Ahab offered to give Naboth a better vineyard or to pay him money.
21.q: What did Ahab offer Naboth for his vineyard?

21.a: Naboth refused to give his vineyard to Ahab because it was the inheritance of his ancestors.
21.q: Why did Naboth refuse to give his vineyard to Ahab?

21.a: Ahab became resentful and angry, went to bed, and refused to eat any food.
21.q: What did Ahab do when Naboth refused to give up his vineyard?

21.a: Ahab's wife, Jezebel, told him to get out of bed, eat, and be happy.
21.q: Who told Ahab to get up from bed, eat, and be happy?

21.a: Jezebel had two dishonest men falsely accuse Naboth of blasphemy against God and the king at a public fast.
21.q: What did Jezebel do to make sure Ahab would get Naboth's vineyard?

21.a: Naboth would be taken out and stoned to death.
21.q: What would be the penalty for Naboth's blasphemy?

21.a: When Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, he went to the vineyard to take possession of it.
21.q: What did Ahab do when Jezebel told him that Naboth was dead?

21.a: Yahweh sent Elijah the Tishbite to the vineyard.
21.q: Who did Yahweh send to the vineyard to meet Ahab?

21.a: Elijah told Ahab that dogs would lick his blood where they had licked the blood of Naboth.
21.q: What did Elijah tell Ahab would happen to him because of his sin?

21.a: Elijah told Ahab that Yahweh said that he would be cut off from every male child and slave and free man in Israel because he had led Israel to sin.
21.q: What message did Elijah deliver to Ahab from Yahweh?

21.a: The dogs would eat Jezebel by the wall of Jezreel.
Ahab tore his clothes, put on sackcloth on his body, and fasted.
21.q: What did Ahab do when he heard these words?

21.a: Yahweh said that he would not bring this disaster in Ahab's day, but would do it in his son's day.
21.q: What did Yahweh do when Ahab humbled himself before him?

22.a: For three years there had been no war between Aram and Israel.
22.q: How long was there no war between Aram and Israel?

22.a: The king of Judah was Jehoshaphat.
22.q: Who was the king of Judah?

22.a: The king of Israel asked Jehoshaphat to go to Ramoth Gilead and make war on the king of Aram.
22.q: What did the king of Israel ask Jehoshaphat to do with him?

22.a: The king of Israel gathered the prophets, 400 men, and asked them about making war on Aram.
22.q: Who did the king of Israel call together to seek the will of Yahweh in this matter?

22.a: The king of Israel called upon Micaiah the son of Imiah.
22.q: From what other prophet did the king of Israel seek advice?

22.a: As the kings Ahab and Jehoshaphat sat on their thrones, all the prophets said to them that they should attack Ramoth Gilead and win.
22.q: As the kings Ahab and Jehoshaphat sat on their thrones before the prophets, what was the prophesy they heard?

22.a: Yes, Micaiah was in agreement with all the other prophets.
22.q: Was Micaiah in agreement with all the other prophets?

22.a: Micaiah told the king of Israel that they would have no shepherd and would be scattered.
22.q: What bad news did Micaiah tell the king of Israel?

22.a: Micaiah told the king of Israel that he would be enticed to go to Ramoth Gilead by the lies his prophets would tell him.
22.q: How did Micaiah tell the king of Israel that he would be enticed to go to Ramoth Gilead?

22.a: The king of Israel ordered that Micaiah be seized and put in prison and be fed only a little bread and water until the king of Israel returned safely.
22.q: What did the king of Israel order to be done to Micaiah?

22.a: The king of Israel disguised himself to avoid capture at Ramoth Gilead.
22.q: What did the king of Israel do to avoid capture in the battle at Ramoth Gilead?

22.a: A soldier of Aram shot his bow at random and it struck Ahab between the joints of his armor.
22.q: How did Ahab receive a serious wound at the battle of Ramoth Gilead?

22.a: His son Ahaziah became king of Israel.
22.q: Who became king at the death of Ahab?

22.a: Jehoshaphat reigned in Jerusalem for twenty-five years.
22.q: How long did Jehoshaphat reign in Jerusalem?

22.a: It was said that Jehoshaphat did what was right in the eyes of Yahweh.
22.q: What was said about the reign of Jehoshaphat?

22.a: It was said that Ahab did what was evil in the eyes of Yahweh.
22.q: What was said about the reign of Ahab?
